result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald A. Koch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Pay costs.  (If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.)

Attend, successfully complete, and pay for the 26-week domestic abuse education class.

Submit to AODA treatment and follow through with all recommendations and requirements of the agent.

Defendant to provide a DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.
Concurrent with: 15CM33

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Cases 15CM33 and 15CM43 concurrent with each other, with huber and 65 days credit.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (Time Served on JOC)

Defendant Gerald A. Koch in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing after revocation in 15CM33 and 15CM43.  Counsel and def address the Court.  ADA asks for more than the recommendation of the agent.  Court orders 9 month concurrent on all counts with huber and 65 days credit.  Costs owed ordered converted to civil judgment.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
RCSD Disposition of warrant or commitment (time served)

Defendant Gerald A. Koch in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  3 cases called together:  15CM43, 15CM48 and 15CM33.

Per Atty. Angel, the parties have reached an agreement to resolve these cases, calling for def's pleas to Counts 1, 2, and 3/knowingly violate TRO in 15CM33 and to the same in 15CM43, and also to bail jumping in 15CM43.  Remaining charges in 15CM33 (Counts 4-7) to be dismissed.  15CM48 to be dismissed but  read in.  $1500 of the bail in15CM33 to be forfeited.

In 15CM33, Def pleads no contest to Counts 1, 2, and 3, all knowingly violate TRO.  In 15CM43, Def pleads no contest to Count 1/knowingly violate d.a. order.  In 15CM43, Def pleads no contest to misd. bail jumping.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

15CM43 - Court sentences def to 30 days jail on the bail jumping charge (Count 2), with huber.  Stayed until on or before June 10, between 6-7 a.m.  On Count 1 and on Counts 1, 2, and 3 in 15CM33, Court sentences def to 2 years probation with conditions of costs as well as attend, succ. complete and pay for 26-wk d.a. class, AODA/treatment as required by probation officer.

$1500 to be forfeited in 15CM33.

15CM48 dismissed/read in as are Counts 4-7 in 15CM33.

2 days credit in 15CM43.

DNA sample to be provided at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before Def signs up for probation.

Defendant Gerald A. Koch in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  3 cases:  15CM33, 43, and 48.  Atty. A states that State's offer was just received; asks for continued status.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Gerald A. Koch

Prior: 1080 E. Kinder Street, Richland Center, WI 53581

Defendant Gerald A. Koch in court with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. A states def will waive formal reading and have NG pleas entered on his behalf.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  April 22 at 10 for status - same date/time as def's other case.  Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
to Those Posting Cash Bond - GK
